column4: Hey, does anyone have any idea why when I burn a CD in Ubuntu, it won't play in my car. However, when I burn the same CD on a windows computer, it'll play fine?
you're not converting the mp3's to wav
kubuntu-restricted-extras and ubuntu-restricted-extras are the packages you may need
Do I get those through synaptic?
What do I do once I get those?
when trying to burn the mp3s you'll notice it will convert the mp3s to wav then it'll burn the cd.
Is this for k3b after I download the restricted packages?
the kubuntu package is and ubuntu package is for brasero
So once I download those, I should just use Brasero?
you could use either one. it is a choice of preference.
Oh. Ok. Well, I haven't had any luck trying to use k3b. So I'll give Brasero a try
after you get those two packages installed goto k3b and the preferences>configure k3b> plugins .. see if all those are installed.
Oh. Ok. So I do need to install Kubuntu too, even though I'm using Ubuntu?
Sorry. I'm struggling tonight. I feel bad that I'm struggling so badly.
you can use any program that kubuntu has in ubuntu.. no worries. everyone has to learn at some point :)
Oh, alright. Yeah, I appreciate you sticking with me :). I have the configuration thing. What should I be looking for in the list?
I have the k3b external audio encoder. That seems like it'd be the right thing
